meanings.def: material made by weaving or knitting cotton, wool, silk, etc.
examples: woollen/cotton/linen cloth
a piece of cloth
His bandages had been made from strips of cloth.
the cloth industry/trade
a cloth bag
cotton fabric
furnishing fabrics
His bandages had been made from strips of cloth.
‘What material is this dress made of?’ ‘Cotton.’
He owns a factory producing a range of textiles.
the textile industry
a jacket made from woollen cloth
She works in the cloth trade.
They used to export cotton cloth.

meanings.def: a piece of cloth, often used for a special purpose, especially cleaning things or covering a table
examples: Wipe the surface with a damp cloth.
Place the dough in a bowl and cover with a clean cloth.
He gently cleaned her face with a wet cloth.
Wipe the table with a damp cloth.

meanings.def: used to refer to Christian priests as a group
examples: a man of the cloth

meanings.def: to do only what you have enough money to do and no more
examples: We wanted to buy a bigger house than this but it was a case of cutting our coat according to our cloth.

idioms.idiom: cut your coat according to your cloth
